greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of sets of nonempty words with a total of n letters over k-ary alphabet such that for k>0 the k-th letter occurs at least once and within each word every letter of the alphabet is at least as frequent as the subsequent alphabet letter; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k <= n.  T(n,k) = 0 for k > n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t) option remember; `if`(t=1, 1/n!,
h:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
add(h(n-i*j, i-1, k)*binomial(g(i, k), j), j=0..n/i)))
mathematica: Sum[b[n - j, j, t - 1]/j!, {j, i, n/t}]];
Sum[h[n - i*j, i - 1, k]*Binomial[g[i, k], j], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 09 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Columns k=0-1 give: A000007, A000009 (for n>0).
First lower diagonal gives A038720 (for n>1).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 20 2018
